    Adding a blog section

    Note: All of the content on this site is under construction. I am mostly working on theme development instead of documentation, so much of the content is acting as filler right now.

    To add blog entries, you add files to your _posts directory. The titles must be in yyyy-mm-dd-postname.md format. This is because Jekyll sorts them by date based on the file name.

    Here's the code for adding a blog. Basically you get the latest posts. 

    {% for post in site.posts %}
{{ post.date | date: "%b %-d, %Y" }}
{{ post.title }}
{% endfor %}

    Here's the same content with some styling around it:

    <h1 class="page-heading">Posts</h1>
<ul class="post-list">
    {% for post in site.posts %}
      <li>
        <span class="post-meta">{{ post.date | date: "%b %-d, %Y" }}</span>
        <h2>
          <a class="post-link" href="{{ post.url | prepend: site.baseurl }}">{{ post.title }}</a>
        </h2>
      </li>
  </ul>
  {% endfor %}

<p class="rss-subscribe">subscribe <a href="{{ "/feed.xml" | prepend: site.baseurl }}">via RSS</a></p>

    Result

    Here's the result:

    Posts

    • Theme updates (Feb 5, 2015)
    • Welcome to Jekyll! (Feb 5, 2015)
    • Some really obnoxiously long post title could be possible so just make sure it doesn't break all the things for real, yo, okay? (Jan 12, 2014)
    • Bacon Ipsum (Long) (Dec 24, 2013)
    • Bacon Ipsum (Tiny) (Dec 18, 2013)
    • Bacon Ipsum (Short) (Dec 18, 2013)
    • The Adventure of the Veiled Lodger (Jul 24, 2012)
    • The Adventure of the Dying Detective (Jun 9, 2012)
    • The Adventure of the Cardboard Box (Nov 11, 2011)
    • Obama Inaugural Address (Jan 20, 2009)
    • America and the Spirit of Volunteerism (Sep 8, 2008)
    • Address to the Nation (Sep 20, 2001)

    subscribe via RSS

    Adding limits

    You can also add a limit to the for loop. You must also specify the tags namespace that you're running the loop in:

    {% for post in site.tags.news limit:2  %}
    //do something
  {% endfor %}

    If you were to just write site.posts, then it would limit the iterations to just 2 for overall posts.

    Site last generated: Feb 19, 2015. Built with Jekyll using the Jekyll-doc theme.
